Package oodp.helper

Class IOHelper

java.lang.Object
oodp.helper.IOHelper
public class IOHelper
extends java.lang.Object
IOHelper class that manages most input/output of the program from menu navigation to primitive user input prompting

  • Field Summary

    Fields
    Modifier and Type Field Description
    static int menu_state
    The current menu page to be displayed
    static boolean poll
    The program exits if poll is ever set to false
    static java.util.Scanner sc
    Scanner singleton

    static void init()
    Initializes the IOHelper for usage This is the main application loop Scanner is set to use newline as separator There is intentionally no option to exit the application as it does not make sense for a point-of-sale (POS) system to be manually exited
    static void reset()
    Sets the current menu back to the main menu

      The program exits if poll is ever set to false

  • Constructor Details

    • IOHelper

      public IOHelper()

  • Method Details

    • init

      public static void init()
      Initializes the IOHelper for usage This is the main application loop Scanner is set to use newline as separator There is intentionally no option to exit the application as it does not make sense for a point-of-sale (POS) system to be manually exited

    • reset

      public static void reset()
      Sets the current menu back to the main menu

    • getInt

      public static int getInt()
      Managed method for getting an integer input from user input (range -2147483647 to 21474863647)
      Returns:
      The integer value that the user has entered

    • getInt

      public static int getInt​(int min, int max)
      Managed method for getting an integer input from user (range defined by min,max)
      Parameters:
      min - The minimum (inclusive) value that the user can enter
      max - The maximum (exclusive) value that the user can enter
      Returns:
      The integer value that the user has entered

    • getInt

      public static int getInt​(int min, int max, boolean maxExits)
      Managed method for choice selection and menu navigation. If the user inputs a value that is equals to the maximum value, the menu exits to the main screen
      Parameters:
      min - The minimum (inclusive) value that the user can enter
      max - The maximum (exclusive) value that the user can enter
      maxExits - If true and the user enters a value that is equal to value of max, the menu exits
      Returns:
      The integer value that the user has entered

    • getInt

      public static int getInt​(int min, int max, boolean maxExits, int exitsTo)
      Managed method for choice selection and menu navigation
      Parameters:
      min - The minimum (inclusive) value that the user can enter
      max - The maximum (exclusive) value that the user can enter
      maxExits - If true and the user enters a value that is equal to value of max, the menu exits
      exitsTo - Main menu = 0, MenuModule = 1, PromotionModule = 2, OrderModule = 3, ReservationModule = 4, Misc = 5
      Returns:
      The integer value that the user has entered

    • getFloat

      public static float getFloat()
      Managed method for getting a float value from user input (range -3.4028235E38 to 3.4028235E38)
      Returns:
      The float value that the user has entered

    • getFloat

      public static float getFloat​(float min, float max)
      Managed method for getting a float value from user input (range min,max)
      Parameters:
      min - The minimum (inclusive) value that the user can enter
      max - The maximum (exclusive) value that the user can enter
      Returns:
      The float value that the user has entered

    • getString

      public static java.lang.String getString​(java.lang.String promptMessage, java.lang.String errorMessage)
      Managed method for getting string from user input without a predefined length requirement The user is not repeatedly prompted for input in this overload.
      Parameters:
      promptMessage - Message to prompt user for input
      errorMessage - Error message to show if there was an exception (excluding min and max length violation)
      Returns:
      The string value that the user has entered

    • getString

      public static java.lang.String getString​(boolean repeatUntilSuccess, java.lang.String promptMessage, java.lang.String errorMessage)
      Managed method for getting string from user input without a predefined length requirement
      Parameters:
      repeatUntilSuccess - If set to true, IO will keep prompting until a successful value is provided
      promptMessage - Message to prompt user for input
      errorMessage - Error message to show if there was an exception (excluding min and max length violation)
      Returns:
      The string value that the user has entered

    • getString

      public static java.lang.String getString​(java.lang.Integer minLength, java.lang.Integer maxLength, boolean repeatUntilSuccess, java.lang.String promptMessage, java.lang.String errorMessage)
      Managed method for getting string from user input
      Parameters:
      minLength - The minimum length (inclusive) of the string that the user is expected to type
      maxLength - The maximum length (exclusive) of the string that the user is expected to type
      repeatUntilSuccess - If set to true, IO will keep prompting until a successful value is provided
      promptMessage - Message to prompt user for input
      errorMessage - Error message to show if there was an exception (excluding min and max length violation)
      Returns:
      The string value that the user has entered

    • getDateTimeBefore

      public static java.util.Date getDateTimeBefore​(java.util.Date dtThreshold, java.lang.String format, boolean repeatUntilSuccess, java.lang.String promptMessage, java.lang.String errorMessage)
      Managed method for getting date and time BEFORE a threshold from IO
      Parameters:
      dtThreshold - The date object for input comparison
      format - The expected date time input format
      repeatUntilSuccess - If set to true, IO will keep prompting until a successful value is provided
      promptMessage - Message to prompt user for input
      errorMessage - Error message to show if there was an exception
      Returns:
      The date value that the user has entered

    • getDateTimeAfter

      public static java.util.Date getDateTimeAfter​(java.util.Date dtThreshold, java.lang.String format, boolean repeatUntilSuccess, java.lang.String promptMessage, java.lang.String errorMessage)
      Managed method for getting date and time AFTER a threshold from IO
      Parameters:
      dtThreshold - The date object for input comparison
      format - The expected date time input format
      repeatUntilSuccess - If set to true, IO will keep prompting until a successful value is provided
      promptMessage - Message to prompt user for input
      errorMessage - Error message to show if there was an exception
      Returns:
      The date value that the user has entered

    • getDateTime

      public static java.util.Date getDateTime​(java.lang.String format, boolean repeatUntilSuccess, java.lang.String promptMessage, java.lang.String errorMessage)
      Managed method for getting date and time from IO
      Parameters:
      format - The expected date time input format
      repeatUntilSuccess - If set to true, IO will keep prompting until a successful value is provided
      promptMessage - Message to prompt user for input
      errorMessage - Error message to show if there was an exception
      Returns:
      The date value that the user has entered
